item.title: There’s more room for risk assets to rally — focus on policy, not politics, HSBC says
item.description: The backdrop for stocks is supportive despite the day-to-day Washington machinations

item.title: ‘His divorce lawyer was completely useless’: My husband is on the mortgage of his ex-wife’s house. She’s behind on the loan. What can we do?
item.description: ‘If he contacts the bank and asks to remove his name from the mortgage because he has no legal responsibility, will they force her to refinance?’

item.title: I’m a mother, 48, of three girls. I earn $200,000 and have a $576,000 mortgage. Should I take out a $60,000 home-equity loan and upgrade my BMW X3?
item.description: “Right now, I do not have a car payment and I pay off my credit-card bills of between $2,000 and $7,000 every month.”

item.title: Mexico’s peso and Canada’s dollar fall on Trump’s 25% tariff threats
item.description: In a post on his social media platform Truth Social, Trump threatened to impose 25% tariffs on all goods imported from both the U.S. and Canada

item.title: 15 stocks — including Palantir and Nvidia — whose sales estimates have risen the most this earnings season
item.description: Other companies whose consensus 2025 revenue estimates have increased the most include BlackRock and Coterra Energy.
